com.explodingbacon.bcnlib.actuators

Class Motor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.explodingbacon.bcnlib.actuators.Motor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FakeMotor, MotorGroup

    public class Motor
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for controlling Motors on the Robot.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Motor

        public Motor(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
             int channel)
        Standard constructor for Motor.
        Type Parameters:
        T - A class that extends SpeedController.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of this Motor.
        channel - The channel (PWM or CAN) of this Motor.

      • Motor

        public Motor(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SpeedController s)
        Constructor a Motor using an existing SpeedController object.
        Parameters:
        s - The SpeedController object.

      • Motor

        protected Motor()
        The constructor to be used when an implementation of Motor does not require the use of a SpeedController. If this constructor is being used, you'll need to override getPower() and setPower() to not use the "sc" variable.

    • Method Detail

      • setName

        public Motor setName(java.lang.String n)
        Sets the name of this Motor.
        Parameters:
        n - The new name of the Motor.
        Returns:
        This Motor (for method chaining and variable saving)

      • getPower

        public double getPower()
        Gets the current power of this Motor. Motor power ranges from 1 to -1.
        Returns:
        The current power of this Motor.

      • setPower

        public void setPower(double d)
        Sets the current power of this Motor. Motor power ranges from 1 to -1.
        Parameters:
        d - The new power of this Motor.

      • setPower

        public void setPower(NetTuner t,
                     double d)
        Sets the current power of this Motor. Motor power ranges from 1 to -1. This method should only be called from BCNLib packages, since it overrides any restrictions.
        Parameters:
        t - A valid NetTuner, for access controllers.
        d - The new power of this Motor

      • isReversed

        public boolean isReversed()
        Checks if this Motor is reversed.
        Returns:
        If this Motor is reversed.

        Parameters:

      • rampUpWait

        public void rampUpWait(int seconds,
                       boolean reversed)
        Ramps up this Motor over a certain amount of seconds.
        Parameters:
        seconds - How may seconds the ramping up will take.
        reversed - If the Motor should run backwards instead of forwards.

      • rampUpWait

        public void rampUpWait(int seconds,
                       boolean reversed,
                       java.util.function.Function<Motor.RampUpData,Motor.RampUpData> function)
        Ramps up this Motor over a certain amount of seconds.
        Parameters:
        seconds - How may seconds the ramping up will take.
        reversed - If the Motor should run backwards instead of forwards.
        function - Code that analyzes the current state of the ramp up, and can possibly cancel the ramping.
